EQUISTAR CHEMICALS, LP  BAYPORT PLANT

            EPA RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN

INTRODUCTION

 The  Federal Clean Air Act (CAA) Amendments of 1990, section 112(r), mandated EPA to establish a program for the industry to  follow  in  prevention  of serious  accidental  chemical releases  that  may  potentially affect the  public  health, welfare, and the environment.

This EPA program addresses the following:

1)    Risk  Management Plan - It summarizes the overall  risk

management  program and was initially submitted  to  EPA  by 6/21/99, and available to state and local emergency planning officials and the public.

2)  Hazard Assessment.

3)  Accident Prevention program for a Level 3 facility

4)    Emergency Response program.

40 CFR 68.155 (a)

ACCIDENTAL   RELEASE    PREVENTION  AND  EMERGENCY   RESPONSE

POLICIES

The  following  represents  Equistar Chemicals' Policy  Statement on Health, Safety and the Environment:

Equistar Chemicals is committed to manage its activities in such  a  way as to take foremost account of:

A?     The  health  and  safety of employees,  contractors,

        customers and the public.

A?        The protection of the environment.

It is committed to implement the Responsible Care program of the Chemical Industry.

In carrying out this policy Equistar Chemicals shall:

A?    Manage HSE Matters as a critical business activity.

A?        Promote good health practices, and ensure a healthy

working environment for employees and contractors.

A?        Maintain a systematic approach to HSE by implementing

an HSE Management System designed to ensure compliance with law, achieve continual performance improvement and prevention of pollution.

A?        Incorporate health, safety and environmental

assessments into all strategic decisions such as acquiring or disposing of assets, and modifying plants or procedures. A?        Ensure the responsible and efficient use of materials

and energy through innovative technology, education, and good management practices.

A?        Promote a positive culture

, which is based on the full

involvement and commitment of staff and the principle that all incidents can be prevented.

A?        Apply the principles of Product Stewardship in all

stages of the life cycle of its products and processes.

A?        Provide emergency response programs to minimize harm to

people, the environment and assets.

A?        Require its contractors to manage HSE in line with this

policy and promote the adoption of this policy inn its Joint Ventures.

A?        Publicly report performance and maintain an open

dialogue with all stakeholders.

 A?    Verify conformance to this policy at all the Company's facilities.

It  is  the responsibility of management to secure  employee commitment in this policy.

40 CFR    68.155 (b)

FACILITY INFORMATION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

The  Equistar Chemicals Bayport Plant is located in the extraterritorial jurisdiction of Pasadena, Texas, approximately 25 miles east-southeast  of the City of Houston. Equistar Chemicals owns and  operates three  basically identical polypropylene manufacturing units at  the  Bayport  facility.  These  systems  produce  mainly homopolymer  with some copolymer production capability.  The loop  reactors  in  this  process  are  fed  with  the  main feedstock,  propylene,  as  well as  smaller  quantities  of ethylene,  donor,  catalyst and mineral oils.  Polypropylene polymer is then formed and passes through a steamer to strip residual  hydrocarbons.  A nitrogen dryer is used to  remove any  remaining moisture and the finished product is  shipped as flake or goes to an extruder for pelletizing.

The  Catalloy  unit  is  a  multipurpose  unit  capable   of producing  homopolymer, copolymer, and terpolymer. Ethylene, propylene, and butene are the main feedstocks to the reactor depending on the desired type of product. Smaller quantities of  catalyst  donor and mineral oil are also  added  to  the reactors.  The  resulting polymers formed pass  through  the steamer  and  dryer,  and the finishe

d product  goes  to  an extruder  for  pelletizing with some  being  loaded  out  as flake.

The polymer is used as a raw material by other companies  to produce  vehicle  bumpers, home sidings,  medical  syringes, shatter-proof packaging that is child safe, bicycle helmets, food  plastic  wrap & containers, disposable  baby  diapers, yarn for clothes and carpets, and tools.

The Equistar Chemicals Bayport plant employs 182  people. The plant property  is approximately 213 acres, 165 of which  is  used for the manufacturing activities.

40 CFR    68.155(c)

GENERAL  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

Processes at Equistar Chemicals are covered by the OSHA PSM rule and the EPA  RMP  rule.   Equistar Chemicals has written procedures  to  verify, manage,  and  audit  ongoing  compliance.   This  prevention program  contains a unit description and affected Chemicals ; process   safety   information;  process  hazard   analysis; standard  operating procedures; employee training  programs; maintenance,  including equipment inspection and  mechanical integrity;   management  of  changes;   pre-startup   safety reviews; internal compliance audits; incident investigation; employee participation; safety (including hot) work permits; contractor safety and evaluations.  Additionally, Equistar Chemicals has developed and implements a Safety Design Criteria (based  on good engineering practices) which is utilized in the design, construction,  production, & preventive maintenance  of  our processes & safe operations.

40 CFR    68.155 (d)

 5-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There  has been no accidental release of a covered  chemical

from  a  covered  process within the last  five  years  that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on-site  or  off-site, and no deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering  in  place,  property  damage,  or  environmental damage.

40 CFR    68.155 (e)

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Equistar Chemicals has e

stablished an Emergency Response Plan (ERP) that details  the  responsibilities of Equistar Chemicals' management  staff and  emergency  response team during  emergency  situations. This  emergency response plan incorporates all OSHA and  EPA regulations  that  may  apply during  emergency  situations, either  by direct reference(s) that may be found in the  ERP or  by reference(s) to other Equistar Chemicals Bayport Plant procedures or  environmental response plans (including, but not limited to,  the  facility's RCRA Contingency Plan, Spill Prevention Control  and  Countermeasures Plan,  etc.).  These  facility emergency   management   plans   provide   information     to respond/protect    the    employees'    and     communities' health/welfare,  the  environment, and  plant  property.  In addition  to  our voice alarm emergency system,  we  have  a dedicated  CAER  phone  line  for  recording  messages for community  Awareness  &  Emergency  Response  during   plant emergency situations.

The  ERP  team consists of volunteers for fire  brigade  and incident  command, medical attendants, rescue, and hurricane crew, along with a medical emergency van, fire truck, and  a command  van.  Our team receives continuous annual  training at  LaPorte Fire Dept., Texas A&M University's fire  school, San  Jacinto  College, and in-house training (i.e.,  HAZMAT) and  drills.  As a member of Channel Industries  Mutual  Aid (CIMA)    for   Harris  County  and  Houston   Ship   Channel industries,  we  actively participate  in  CIMA  drills  and provide  actual emergency response for other plants.  Equistar Chemicals is  an  active  participant in our local emergency  planning committee (LEPC), the La Porte LEPC.



40 CFR    68.155 (f)

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Equistar Chemicals  is  always  in  search of and implementing  positive change, new design, standards, and methods that will add  to our  safety,  accident  prevention, and  emergency  response principles & procedures.
